alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:09PM EST until February 03 at 6:08AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash River. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. This ice jam threat should come to an end over the weekend, but minor river flooding along the Wabash is expected to continue well into next week, aided by additional rainfall expected during the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 03... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma. * WHEN...Until Saturday, February 03. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Park in southern Montezuma begins to flood. Higher bottomlands begin to flood. Water backs up most local tributaries. River water is at the top of some private levees. Lowest county roads begin to flood. Parke CR 75 W begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EST Friday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, February 02. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Saturday afternoon by around noon EST /1100 AM CST/.
